intro: Croton bogotanus, commonly known as the Bogotá croton, is a shrub native to the Andean regions of Colombia. It is characterized by its thick, waxy leaves that are often green with prominent veins. The plant produces small, clustered yellow flowers that are typically followed by distinctive, spiky fruits. It thrives in humid, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
